section.title: About ShmooMaker
section.para: ShmooMaker is a utility for making shmoos. A shmoo is a lovable, globular beastie with a penchant for turning himself into other objects. Everyone loves shmoos due to their warm and cuddly nature.

section.title: Installing ShmooMaker

section.title: Configuring ShmooMaker
section.para: ShmooMaker creates a basic system configuration template for shmoos in the /etc/ folder. The configuration file is called /etc/shmoos. You can add your own user-specific shmoo information by creating a file in your home directory called ~/.shmoos. The /etc/shmoos file resembles the following:
To edit the system configuration template, use the root account.

section.title: Using ShmooMaker
section.para: To run ShmooMaker, select it from the GUI menu under Applications Entertainment ShmooMaker .
If you want to run ShmooMaker as a daemon process, use the command shmoo-maker -d.
